title: The closest you'd probably get to a Rajput jail
review: The large bulbous bastion on your right as you pass through the Surya Gate was once a prison for the Maharaja's enemies.

title: Surya Gate
review: The Surya gate is the main entrance to the world famous Jaisalmer Fort. The entrance is quiet imposing and makes a very good backdrop for photography.

title: A magnificent entrance to fort
review: This gate is huge, and marvellous majestic entrance to the huge fort. Studs would be applied to this type of gate to prevent enemies using elephants to knock down the gates in periods of siege

title: Fort come hotel
review: Best property on sam Road will feel like maharaja also good for destination weeding one of the good hotel in jaisalmer

title: Surya Gate
review: Surya Gate is historic place, the famous gate in jaisalmer. mainly there is 4 gates. this is not a big place, you can skip this.

title: Stunning Gate
review: There are 4 gates this being the second gate - the Sunrise falls on this gate and the approach is just so royal! You will enjoy every bit of it - ensure you have a Govt approved Guide along

title: One of Four
review: This Gate is apparently one of the four gates of entry to Jaisalmer Fort, each one comes in after another and have been named so.

title: Busy tourist path
review: This is the entrance from the city to the fort.

title: great experience
review: Made to protect the city from the enemies, built in the 12th century this entrance of the jaisalmer fort is one of oldest gate, and worthed to see.

title: As Gates to Fortso go, this is one the most fascinating in all of Jaisalmer
review: People could got through this from both directions, even at the same time, and at the same time as Mopeds and Bikes. Miraculous

title: Unavoidable
review: This is the entrance to the fort, which is inhabited. This is what we are here for. The fort as a whole.

title: Entrance to the great fort
review: Surya Ghar or surya gate is the main entrance to the jaisalmer fort.Its a bit narrow only the auto can go in or better you have to walk in.The ceiling is typical and it is made of wooden logs. Raw logs are arranged and on top of it its paved with sand stone slabs.

title: Good
review: Boss avoid auto near fort you go by walk it takes hardly 10 mins to reach fort while going you can see for gates its better take young guide as he ll be updated to current thing near nd inside fort

title: Gateway to Jaisalmer Fort
review: This is the entrance to Jaisalmer fort. It was made to protect the fort from enemies. Amazing workmanship

title: Fort
review: Surya Gate is the first entrance of the Jaisalmer fort. The name is derived from the fact that Sun falls at this gate first before travelling to other places in the fort.Nothing great

title: The first entrance to Fort
review: There are three pole to enter the fort and first is surya Gate. More crowded by local rikshowala to stand in que for entry.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Surya Gate is first entrance gate for Entrance to Jaisalmer Fort and a part of this fort. The structure of this gate is very strong.

title: yes in fact it is the first gate
review: As everybody else tells, yes, I can confirm: this is the first gate to the Fort. Means, ok, when you come from the city you have to pass first another gate, which is not exactly belonging to the Fort walls but little bit away, obviously protecting the parking and some shops from enemies, so correctly spoken that would be the second gate you have to pass on your way up there, but it is the first gate of the Fort considering that it is a part of the Fort's fortifications ...

title: It's a gate through time!!
review: As you stand in front of Surya Gate, you can imagine yourself as a weary desert traveller on the Silk Road hundreds of years ago.  Passing through the gate you step back in time, in a way.  The old gate holds a ton of history as the only real way to get in to Jaisalmer's fortified inner city.

title: as gates go this one has more traffic
review: nothing really special about this one other than it's very narrow and very busy and the floor has become polished sandstone, so supper slippy.

title: View of the fort entrance
review: This is about 1-2kms close to the fort . You will find lot of tour guides who will take you up to the fort.

title: Can be better!!
review: Its the entrance to the fort. There is a tourist office box here but only box its not manned. There are banners near the gate which are't needed here. Autos available at gate which drive you till top

title: Ancient Gate of jaisalmer
review: Surya gate is one of the gates of the ancient Jaisalmer fort located in the Thar Desert.It is a narrow gate with stone carvings.There are jain and Hindu temples located near the gate.

title: on the road to the fort
review: One of the gates you have to go throught on the waz to the fort. Be careful because otherwise you wont notice it. You will just notice all the shops on the place behind and the view of the fort itself.

title: Girl on a wire
review: The bustling large courtyard shops and stalls outside Surya gate, Suraj Pol, offer all manner of goods and services. On the day we visited this included boys playing cricket on the parapets and a young girl displaying her talents as a tightrope walker whilst her parents collected their daily income from the appreciative passers by.

title: Impressive !
review: Massive entrance to the "Golden Fort" is very impressive indeed.  One can only imagine the problems any attackers must have had trying to enter the fort.

title: The main Door !
review: It is the main entrance to the fort and no public vehicles are allowed beyond this point. however there are rickshaws available which can take you in and out of the fort if you do not wish to walk.

title: Entrance to the Golden Fort
review: This narrow gate to the Jaisalmer fort was built in the 12th century to thwart enemies, and protect the city.

title: Beautiful!
review: This is the entrance to the palace in which our hotel was.

title: The Golden Fort Gateway..
review: Its a beautifully crafted passage to enter the fort. You either have to walk or use local transport like rickshaws. Can't take your personal vehicle inside.

title: Atmospheric entrance to this enchanting ancient domicile
review: The walk to and from the palace is rewarding, not least when you realize people still live here.

title: Main entrance to the fot
review: This is just the main entrance to the fort and there is not really much else to say about it. There are many touts and rickshaw drivers looking for business so beware.

title: Just usual fort entrance except golden color stone
review: Ok for a photo stop and not exactly in great shape. Too many locals and crowd and not exactly great shape or maintained

title: Entrance to Fort
review: Its an entrance to the fort.

title: The first of 4 gates to the Jaisalmer Fort
review: This is probably the largest gate, Each of the next three seem to get narrower and narrower as you climb steadily up to the Fort proper. Go carefully through the next three as cars, bikes, motorcycles, taxis. jeeps, rickshaws cattle, dogs and people all try to go both ways through the narrow gates all at the same time. Each gate is through about 10-20 metres of rock/sandstone wall. The horn blasting can get quite ear piercing!.

title: Part of the Fort
review: The gate is a part of the fort.Cant understand as to why it deserves a seperate mention.Not very awe inspiring.

title: Surya Gate
review: Surya Gate is also a very good attraction of jaisalmer fort entrance of jaisalmer fort vey beautiful view.

title: One of a series of gates to enter the fort
review: There are a series of gates that you must go through to enter the fort... all are a part of the journey.  They are crowded and shared between tourists, locals, motorbikes and tuk tuks and livestock.... and of course horn beeping... which can be deafening inside the gate sections as they can be 8 to 20 metres long... depending on the width of the wall at that place.  this gate is called Surya because it gets the first sun of the day.  Nice carvings and lots of history. I love this fort.

title: Excellent Gate
review: Entrance of the fort with excellent carvings. you will find an amazing fort with people living inside.

title: Very good
review: This is one of the entrance gate of jaisalmer fort.it has good carved architecture.but this gate is narrow.it is ancient gate.I visited here in Feb 2015.

title: Second Gate of Gaisalmer Fort
review: This gate is second gate when you enter Jaisalmer Fort. "Suraj Pol" is written on the gate. The upper part of the gate is quite beautiful. You can also Idol of Ganesha on the to of this gate, which is considered auspicious as per Hindu Religion.

title: The Second of Four Gates of Jaisalmer Fort
review: The Gates are iconic and without any entry fee. Only the King's Court and Queens residences have nominal charges. The scenic beauty is iconic and must visit.

title: The gate to receive the first rays of the sun
review: The Surya Gate is named as it is the first to receive the sunrise. It throws a golden colour hue to the ramparts and can be visited during fort visit only.

title: Nice Gate
review: It is one of oldest gate. It is inside the golden fort. All the gates are so beautiful and very old.

title: entrance to fort
review: old narrow gate which is entrance to the jaisalmer fort, it is where the first rays of the sun fall, nice entrance to an amazing fort

title: Nothing Extraordinary
review: It is just a small gate to the entrance to the fort. You wouldn't even notice its name of presence. I don't know why its even listed here.

title: Gate-Way to Golden Fort!
review: This is one of the main entrances (Second Gate after the main entrance gate from the market) of the golden fort with a typical "Toran" on it's top and two big towers.

title: door to the fort nothing great
review: This door is just an entry door like many other doors for the Jaisalmer fort. You will invariably pass through this when you enter the fort

title: Good
review: Its is an integral part of Jaisalmer Fort. But has its own importance as it is the entrance of the fort. The carvings are good and the grandness of it is easily visible.

title: Leaves you in awe
review: One of the many pols of the Jaisalmer fort . Leaves you in awe. Loved every bit of the experience and meticulous planning

title: Good.
review: This gate is one of the many gates we go through while walking to the fortress. This is a beautifully carved gate. This is majestic and huge.

title: Sunrise...!!
review: Just on the entry to the fort is this Surya gate, very old structure, solidly built according to the direction of the sun rises so that 1st sun light hits it

title: another gate
review: this is the second gate leading into the fort.try and walk up to the fort as you will see things that your guide will not show you

title: Look up to see the intricate carving
review: Suraj or Surya Pol is the second gate into the fort.

title: Massive Entrance
review: When you are primarily going to Jaisalmer to see the fort, you will have to pass through this entrance anyway so it’s impossible to miss. We recommend spending a few minutes to appreciate its design and concept, thinking of its significance to the long-standing defense of this 850+ yr old fort. The Surya Gate is one of the primary reasons this fort has remained intact. The concept of the curved and narrow entrance into the Jaisalmer fort was to prevent enemies from being able to charge properly into the fort and to prohibit their ability to use a battering ram I suppose. We were so very impressed with the ingenuity of this idea for defending a walled city and fort that we found this to be a very interesting minor attraction to Jaisalmer.

title: Picture perfect
review: The Suraj Pol is the second gate that we encountered while entering the Jaisalmer fort.

title: Historic fort with amazing views of Jaisalmer city
review: Close to the Pakistan border. Fort was very majestic with very narrow winding passage ways. One has to be careful to keep one's head from hitting the roof especially while entering an arch. This was designed specifically to prevent invaders from swarming in.

title: One of the Gates of Jaisalmer Fort
review: This is one of the gates while entering Jaisalmer Fort. All forts have a series of gates, and this happens to be one of the three (if I remember correct) gates to the fort.

title: Great place
review: when you enter the fort from this gate there are lots of attraction and there are lots of tourists from different part of the world   the guide gave us a full history of the place and people are still living in the fort like in the past where the cast system is still  present  in the daily life without any argument or discrimination. It was amazing to watch how they live.

title: Excellent way to enter a fort
review: The concept of the curved and narrow entrance into the Jaisalmer fort was to prevent enemies from being able to charge properly into the fort and to prohibit their ability to use a battering ram I suppose.  We were so very impressed with the ingenuity of this idea for defending a walled city and fort that we found this to be a very interesting minor attraction to Jaisalmer.

title: The closest you'd probably get to a Rajput jail
review: The large bulbous bastion on your right as you pass through the Surya Gate was once a prison for the Maharaja's enemies.

title: This is a fort gate
review: Very old and ancient place maintained by the toursim people. Nice carvings done on the gate and very photogenic place.

title: second  gate
review: it is second gate of jaisalmer fort  . fort have 4 gate frist is akhey pol second Surya pol third is ganesh pol and last is hava pol . (pol means gate ) you can not see a agte from another is locate in turn because kings time they use elephant to break the gate so when elephant turn he lose his power and unable to break
